					<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/green-tobacco-sickness-can-be-caused-by-compost-heat-the-smell-of-the-tobacco-plants-or-pesticide__trashed/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Dec 2020 19:43:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/fr/?post_type=health&#038;p=1643</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:fr]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"red"} -->
<p class="has-red-color has-text-color">Green Tobacco Sickness can be caused by compost, heat, the smell of the tobacco plants or pesticide.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate-plus"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-plus-font-size">Nicotine causes Green Tobacco Sickness.<br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Once a room has been sufficiently ventilated, secondhand smoke no longer poses any danger.</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/smoking-gives-you-protection-from-green-tobacco-sickness-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Dec 2020 19:20:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/fr/?post_type=health&#038;p=1645</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"red","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-red-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">Once a room has been sufficiently ventilated, secondhand smoke no longer poses any danger.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Residue from tobacco smoke can linger on surfaces, furniture, floors and walls for several months. This is known as <strong>thirdhand smoke. </strong>Infant and young children are thought to be most at risk of exposure.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:fr]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"red","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-red-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size"></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size"></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Sample Page</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/sample-page/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Aug 2020 10:51:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://tobacco.dgstg.org/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:quote {"className":"is-style-large"} -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote is-style-large"><p>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)</p></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>...or something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:quote {"className":"is-style-large"} -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote is-style-large"><p>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.</p></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href="https://tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-admin/">your dashboard</a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[sample-page]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<title>Privacy Policy</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?page_id=3</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 26 Aug 2020 10:51:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://tobacco.dgstg.org/?page_id=3</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we are</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Our website address is: https://tobacco.dgstg.org.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>What personal data we collect and why we collect it</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Comments</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor&#8217;s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Media</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Contact forms</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Cookies</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select &quot;Remember Me&quot;, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Embedded content from other websites</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Analytics</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we share your data with</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>How long we retain your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>What rights you have over your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Where we send your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Your contact information</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Additional information</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>How we protect your data</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>What data breach procedures we have in place</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>What third parties we receive data from</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Industry regulatory disclosure requirements</h3><!-- /wp:heading -->]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_id>3</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-08-26 10:51:45]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-08-26 10:51:45]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[privacy-policy]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>About</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/sample-page-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2020 12:09:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:quote -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote"><p>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)</p></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>...or something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:quote -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote"><p>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.</p></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href="http://localhost/wp-admin/">your dashboard</a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>26</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-08-25 12:09:38]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-08-25 12:09:38]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[sample-page-2]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Research & Publications</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/privacy-policy-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2020 12:09:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=3</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Who we are</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Our website address is: http://localhost.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>What personal data we collect and why we collect it</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Comments</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Media</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Contact forms</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Cookies</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Embedded content from other websites</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Analytics</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Who we share your data with</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>How long we retain your data</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>What rights you have over your data</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Where we send your data</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Your contact information</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>Additional information</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>How we protect your data</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>What data breach procedures we have in place</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>What third parties we receive data from</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->
<!-- wp:heading {"level":3} -->
<h3>Industry regulatory disclosure requirements</h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[privacy-policy-2]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_menu_item_url]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>

		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/2020/10/09/illicit-trade/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2020 11:06:35 +0000</pubDate>

					<item>
		<title>Prevalence and Loss in Tax Revenue</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/prevalence-and-loss-in-tax-revenue/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov 2020 14:15:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=392</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>2017 Illicit trade in South Africa</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"super"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-super-font-size">30%-35%</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":40} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:40%"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">In March 2020 the South African government banned all tobacco sales to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The ban was lifted nearly 5 months later in August 2020. During the ban, tobacco prices increased significantly (by 250% on average) and smokers shifted to smoking different brands.<br><br><span class="has-inline-color has-blue-color"><a href="https://localhost/illicit/prevalence-and-loss-in-tax-revenue/">read more</a></span></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>2017 Illicit trade in South Africa</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"super"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-super-font-size">30%-35%</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":40} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:40%"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size">In March 2020 the South African government banned all tobacco sales to reduce the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The ban was lifted nearly 5 months later in August 2020. During the ban, tobacco prices increased significantly (by 250% on average) and smokers shifted to smoking different brands.<br><br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">In June to July 2020, a survey (not nationally representative) conducted in over 23,000 people&nbsp; found that 9% of respondents quit smoking during the ban. Of those that continued smoking, 93% bought cigarettes during the ban. The main sources for purchasing cigarettes were friends and family (27%), spaza shops (25%), street vendors (11%) and WhatsApp groups (8%). Formal retail outlets, tobacconists and garage forecourt shops which used to constitute 70% of sales before the ban had been reduced to less than 1% of sales. None of the top ten cigarette brands bought before the ban (which were mostly from multinational companies like British American Tobacco, Philip Morris International, Japan Tobacco International and Imperial Tobacco) were in the top ten bought during the ban.. It is unclear how the ban and emergent illicit activity will affect&nbsp; future tobacco trade in South Africa. <br><a href="/impact" data-type="URL" data-id="/impact">See the ‘Impact of Policies’ factsheet for more information.</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>809</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-30 14:15:01]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-30 14:15:01]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[prevalence-and-loss-in-tax-revenue]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="prevalence"><![CDATA[Prevalence]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[prevalence-of-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_date]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020-10-06]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[enprevalence-and-loss-in-tax-revenue]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[inline_featured_image]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Increase in tax leads to an increase in Illicit trade.</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/enincrease-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Nov 2020 12:43:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1060</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Increase in tax leads to an increase in Illicit trade.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Independent research shows increasing tobacco taxes does not necessarily increase illicit trade<br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size"><strong><span style="color:#202121" class="has-inline-color">The share of illicit tobacco in South Africa remained low and consistent from 1995 - 2009</span></strong>, at a time when taxes increased rapidly<strong><span style="color:#000000" class="has-inline-color"> (more than 10% in real terms each year)</span></strong>. Most of the increase in the illicit market occurred from 2010 when the real taxes increased at an average rate of less than 2% each year. <br>There have been similar findings in other developing countries including Chile, Columbia and Mongolia.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">Between 2010 - 2014, Chile increased taxes moderately and the real price of cigarettes increased by 68%. Despite this, there is no evidence that the size of the illicit market changed between 2008 - 2014.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">In Colombia, excise tax increased by 300% over a 3 year period. Over the same time, consumption of tobacco decreased by 33% and tax revenue increased by 91%. The size of the illicit tobacco market was estimated to be between one-third to two-thirds of the total market in the early 2000s. By 2017 it had to decrease to less than 2% of the market despite significant tax increases.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">In Mongolia, import tobacco tax by 30% in May 2017 and excise tobacco tax by 10% in January 2018. During this time, it is estimated that illicit consumption almost halved.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1064,"width":868,"height":219,"sizeSlug":"full"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-full is-resized"><img src="http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/info_graphic_myths.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1064" width="868" height="219"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1060</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-04 12:43:56]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[enincrease-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="myths"><![CDATA[Myths]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[independent-research-shows-increasing-tobacco-taxes-does-not-necessarily-increase-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[inline_featured_image]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Illicit cigarettes are only manufactured by local South African companies.</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/enillicit-cigarettes-are-only-manufactured-by-local-south-african-companies/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Nov 2020 12:42:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1073</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Both local and international companies contribute to the illicit tobacco trade in South Africa.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">In Africa, since the 1980s, “smuggling has been an important component of BAT’s market entry strategy in order to gain leverage in negotiating with governments for tax concessions … circumvent local import restrictions and unstable political and economic conditions and gain a market presence. BAT worked through distributors and local agents to exploit weak government capacity to gain substantial market share in major countries.”In South Africa in 2018, BAT was charged R214 million ($15 million) in an assessment for duty evasion.<br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">In various lower- and middle-income countries, independent researchers have found large international tobacco brands contributing to illicit tobacco trade such as in Mongolia and Georgia.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1073</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-04 12:42:13]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-04 12:42:13]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[enillicit-cigarettes-are-only-manufactured-by-local-south-african-companies]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="myths"><![CDATA[Myths]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[increase-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[increase-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade-2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Georgia decreased the size of the illicit tobacco market (while increasing taxes)</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/engeorgia-decreased-the-size-of-the-illicit-tobacco-market-while-increasing-taxes/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 28 Nov 2020 12:46:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1079</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">In the republic of Georgia, almost 50% of cigarettes were illegal in the first decade of the 21st century. <strong>Georgia successfully implemented progressive economic reforms in its Revenue and Customs services including requiring tax stamps on all tobacco products</strong>. Currently these are only used for tracing, though they have the ability to be used for both tracking and tracing. As a result illicit cigarette consumption fell to 1.5% of total consumption in 2018. This reduction in illicit consumption coincided with significant increases to Georgian excise taxes</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1079</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-28 12:46:00]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-28 12:46:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[engeorgia-decreased-the-size-of-the-illicit-tobacco-market-while-increasing-taxes]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="stories"><![CDATA[Stories]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[independent-research-shows-increasing-tobacco-taxes-does-not-necessarily-increase-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[increase-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_998543ec0bdcec38a64ce4b559d4d4ee]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<iframe title="Questions over England&#039;s ‘track-and-trace’ system | Coronavirus" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HtvSdhgaX2Q?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_time_998543ec0bdcec38a64ce4b559d4d4ee]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1604664323]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[enkenyas-track-and-trace-system-increased-excise-tax-revenue]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1312]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_date]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020-11-04]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Kenya’s Track and Trace System increased excise tax revenue.</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/enkenyas-track-and-trace-system-increased-excise-tax-revenue/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov 2020 13:19:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1102</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:heading {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<h2 class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">Kenya implemented a track and trace system in 2013 resulting in a 20% increase in excise tax revenue between 2013 and 2016.</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">The Kenyan Revenue Authority estimates that the illicit cigarette trade market share declined from 12% in 2013 to 5% in 2016, a direct result of the implemented measures (track and trace).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":1089,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/image.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1089"/><figcaption><br><br></figcaption></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1102</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-30 13:19:00]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-30 13:19:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[enkenyas-track-and-trace-system-increased-excise-tax-revenue]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="kenya"><![CDATA[Kenya]]></category>
		<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="stories"><![CDATA[Stories]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[independent-research-shows-increasing-tobacco-taxes-does-not-necessarily-increase-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[increase-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_998543ec0bdcec38a64ce4b559d4d4ee]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<iframe title="Questions over England&#039;s ‘track-and-trace’ system | Coronavirus" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HtvSdhgaX2Q?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_time_998543ec0bdcec38a64ce4b559d4d4ee]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1604499412]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1311]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_date]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020-12-04]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Types of Illicit Tobacco Products</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/types-of-illicit-tobacco-products/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 05 Nov 2020 15:29:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1129</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1175,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_contraband.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1175"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Contraband</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">These tobacco products are produced legally, but the appropriate taxes are not paid, thus they are illicit.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1176,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_counterfeit.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1176"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Counterfeit</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">These tobacco products are illegally produced and have fake manufacturing labels and trademarks. These<br>products infringe on intellectual property rights, may not pass health regulations, and the appropriate taxes<br>are not paid. Counterfeit cigarettes are relatively rare, estimated to make up just 2% of global illicit cigarettes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1180,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_cheap.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1180"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Cheap Whites</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">These tobacco products are produced legally but for the sole purpose of being exported and illegally sold in another market where they are not legal. They may not meet the destination country’s health standards and the appropriate taxes are not paid here (though in some cases the appropriate taxes are paid in the country of production). These are also sometimes referred to as ‘illicit whites’ or ‘off-brand’.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns {"verticalAlignment":"top"} -->
<div class="wp-block-columns are-vertically-aligned-top"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1178,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_loose.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1178"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Loose tobacco</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Loose tobacco refers to the tobacco used to manufacture cigarettes. If the appropriate taxes are not paid<br>or the appropriate health checks not conducted on the loose tobacco, then it is deemed illicit</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1129</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-05 15:29:20]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-05 15:29:20]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[types-of-illicit-tobacco-products]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="types-products"><![CDATA[Types / Products]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Types of Illicit Tobacco Taxes</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/entypes-of-illicit-tobacco-taxes/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 05 Nov 2020 18:17:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1159</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1171,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_import_duties.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1171"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Import Duties</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Tax levied on selected imported goods destined for local consumption (i.e. not in transit).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1172,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_vat.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1172"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">VAT</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Levied as a percentage of the value of many different products (in SA the VAT rate is 15%), aimed at<br>raising revenue.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"right","id":1173,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignright size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/icon_taxes.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1173"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Excise Taxes</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">These are typically levied on specific products, like tobacco, alcohol and, recently, on sugar-sweetened<br>beverages in South Africa, with the primary aim to discourage their consumption. <br>Excise taxes are typically levied as: </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size"><strong>Specific excise tax</strong>: Monetary value per quantity (e.g. pack/piece/weight).<br><strong>Ad valorem excise tax</strong>: Levied as a percentage of the product value.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1159</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-05 18:17:02]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-05 18:17:02]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[entypes-of-illicit-tobacco-taxes]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="types-taxes"><![CDATA[Types / Taxes]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[types-of-illicit-tobacco-products]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Romania improved tobacco control enforcement and reduced illicit trade</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/georgia-decreased-the-size-of-the-illicit-tobacco-market-while-increasing-taxes/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Nov 2020 14:45:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1225</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">In early 2010, between 19% - 30% of tobacco in Romania was purchased on the illicit market. To combat this, Romania took steps to improve enforcement of tobacco control policies. In the first phase, from 2010 - 2012, they aimed to:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>create a better legislative framework&nbsp;</li><li>strengthen the administrative capacity of Customs&nbsp;</li><li>focus on specific and more effective controls to curb cigarette smuggling.</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">By the end of 2013, the size of the illicit market had decreased to 11.4% of the total market.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1225</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-18 14:45:22]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-18 14:45:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[georgia-decreased-the-size-of-the-illicit-tobacco-market-while-increasing-taxes]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="stories"><![CDATA[Stories]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[independent-research-shows-increasing-tobacco-taxes-does-not-necessarily-increase-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[increase-in-tax-leads-to-an-increase-in-illicit-trade]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_998543ec0bdcec38a64ce4b559d4d4ee]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<iframe title="Questions over England&#039;s ‘track-and-trace’ system | Coronavirus" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HtvSdhgaX2Q?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_time_998543ec0bdcec38a64ce4b559d4d4ee]]></wp:meta_key>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1313]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Tax revenue estimated to be lost through Illicit Trade</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/tax-revenue-estimated-to-be-lost-through-illicit-trade/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov 2020 13:57:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=illicit&#038;p=1239</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>Tax revenue estimated to be lost through Illicit Trade</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"huge"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-huge-font-size">6 billion rands</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":40} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:40%"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size">The estimated loss of tax revenue due to illicit trade in tobacco products for 2017 was R5.028 billion. This estimate is&nbsp; based on the following assumptions: assuming a minimum R21 price for a pack of legal cigarettes and price elasticity of -0.6. This estimate assumes that if the price of illicit cigarettes increases to R21, meaning smokers will be forced to move from low-cost illegal cigarettes to legal, but fully-taxed cigarettes, then the consumption of cigarettes will decrease.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1239</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-30 13:57:02]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-30 13:57:02]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[tax-revenue-estimated-to-be-lost-through-illicit-trade]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="illicit_category" nicename="prevalence"><![CDATA[Prevalence]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Age</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/gender/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2020 12:13:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=7</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","className":"compacted","textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center compacted has-light-blue-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong>In 2017, smoking prevalence was significantly higher amongst 25 to 54 year olds (approx. 23%) compared to those aged 18 to 24 years (15.3%) or those aged 55 years and over (16.1%)</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-small-font-size">For the latter two groups (18-24 &amp; 55+), smoking prevalence rates are similar and do not differ statistically from each other.* Tobacco sales are illegal to anyone under the age of 18, therefore that group is excluded from all reported prevalence estimates. However, for the sake of comparison, the smoking prevalence rate among 15 - 17 year olds was 5.3%. Preventing young people from initiating or experimenting with smoking is crucial to stopping them from becoming long-term, lifelong smokers. *These estimates may still be interpreted as an accurate representation of prevalence for each group.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":544,"sizeSlug":"large","className":"is-style-default"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image is-style-default"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/age_main-1.svg" alt="" class="wp-image-544"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>7</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-08-25 12:13:45]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[gender]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="age"><![CDATA[age]]></category>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Partners</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/partners/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:36:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=41</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>44</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-08-31 18:36:43]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-08-31 18:36:43]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[partners]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Prevalence</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 01 Sep 2020 12:23:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=50</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":77.5} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:77.5%"><!-- wp:heading {"level":1,"textColor":"blue","className":"compacted"} -->
<h1 class="has-blue-color has-text-color compacted">Prevalence of Cigarette Use in South Africa</h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-medium-font-size has-dark-gray-color"><strong>This information is illustrated in a combination of either infographics or charts. All data were calculated using the National Income Dynamics Survey,  Fifth Wave, 2017 accessed through the <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://www.datafirst.uct.ac.za/dataportal/index.php/catalog/712" target="_blank">DataFirst site </a> in response to the question asked of individuals 18 years of age and above:  “Do you smoke?”</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":47.2} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:47.2%"><!-- wp:heading {"level":4,"textColor":"light-blue"} -->
<h4 class="has-light-blue-color has-text-color">Tobacco Prevalence</h4>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-large-font-size has-light-blue-color"><strong>20.5% of adults (aged 18+) smoked combustible cigarettes in South Africa in 2017</strong>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">In comparison, the rates of cigarette smoking were 7.7% in Kenya in 2015 and 3.7% in Nigeria in 2012, the latest years for which data are available in these countries.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"width":33.33} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:33.33%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":329,"sizeSlug":"large","className":"is-style-default"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image is-style-default"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/prevalence_main.png" alt="" class="wp-image-329"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-small-font-size">Source, Nigeria: <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://www.who.int/tobacco/global_report/Table-11-1-Adult-tobacco-surveys-tobacco-use-and-smoking.xls" target="_blank">WHO, Table 11.1.0</a>, Most recent survey of tobacco use, smoking or cigarette use among adults in WHO member states, globally. <br>Source, Kenya: <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190320120819/https://www.who.int/tobacco/surveillance/survey/gats/Kenya-report-2014.pdf?ua=1" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Kenya Global Adult Tobacco Survey</a>, 2015.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>50</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-09-01 12:23:27]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-09-01 12:23:27]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette Use by Race</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/reace/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2020 12:13:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=7</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"huge","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-huge-font-size has-green-color compacted">Smoking prevalence was highest amongst Coloured people (42.7%), and lowest among Black people (17.3%).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Despite low smoking prevalence rates for Black South Africans,&nbsp; approximately 81% of the South African population are Black, hence in 2017, Black smokers constituted the greatest number of smokers in the population, 5.1 million people, compared to 1.5 million Coloured smokers, and 1.3 million White/Indian-Asian smokers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":442,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/race_main-1.svg" alt="" class="wp-image-442"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-small-font-size">Source:&nbsp;<a href="http://www.statssa.gov.za/?page_id=1854&amp;PPN=P0302&amp;SCH=7048" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Statistics South Africa</a>, Country Projection by population group, sex and age (2002 to 2017).</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>106</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-08-25 12:13:45]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-08-25 12:13:45]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[reace]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="race"><![CDATA[race]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[gender]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Gender</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/gender-prevalence/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:17:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=116</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"huge","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-huge-font-size has-green-color compacted"><strong>35.7% of men and 7.2% of women smoked in 2017</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Recent evidence suggests that with the ease of access to e-cigarettes by young South Africans through online sources, as well as the lack of regulation and misleading marketing claims, current smoking levels may increase if standards and regulations are not enforced.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":423,"sizeSlug":"large","className":"is-style-default"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image is-style-default"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/gender_main.svg" alt="" class="wp-image-423"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-small-font-size">Source: <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/329043733_A_content_analysis_of_e-cigarettes_selling_propositions_on_South_African_retail_websites" target="_blank">Muposhi, A. &amp; Dhurup, M. (2018)</a>. A content analysis of e-cigarettes selling propositions on South African retail websites.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>116</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-09-04 18:17:38]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
