		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="gender"><![CDATA[gender]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Location</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/cigarette-use-by-location/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2020 14:52:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=144</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"huge","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-text-align-center has-huge-font-size has-light-blue-color compacted"><strong>Prevalence in urban areas (23.5%) </strong><br><strong>was higher than in rural areas (14.4%). </strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-text-align-center has-medium-font-size has-dark-gray-color"><strong>This finding is especially important given that approximately 54.0% of the South African population live in urban areas</strong><br>Lower prevalence in rural areas may be related to cultural taboos against smoking, particularly among young girls.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":440,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/location_main-2.svg" alt="" class="wp-image-440"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"right","textColor":"dark-gray","customFontSize":11} -->
<p style="font-size:11px" class="has-text-color has-text-align-right has-dark-gray-color"><strong>Source</strong>: <a href="https://bmcpediatr.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2431-11-58" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Mashita, R. J., et al. (2011)</a>. Current smoking behaviour among rural South African children: Ellisras Longitudinal Study. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>144</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-08-25 14:52:00]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-08-25 14:52:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-location]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="location"><![CDATA[location]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-age]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_date]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2020-09-10]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-location__trashed]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Gender and Race</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/cigarette-use-by-gender-race/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Sep 2020 13:17:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=189</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"large","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-large-font-size has-green-color compacted"><strong>Within race groups, males had a higher rate of smoking prevalence compared to females in all race groups in 2017.</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">The difference is largest for the African population where only 2.4% of women smoke compared to 34.3% of males. Coloured men had the highest smoking prevalence rate (55.1%). The smoking rates of Asian / Indian and White men (32.0%) and coloured women (33.2%) do not differ statistically, however these estimates may still be interpreted as an accurate representation of prevalence for each group.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-small-font-size"> (*) We had initially combined Whites with Asian-Indians because there were insufficient numbers (<100) in the Asian-Indian sample. SA team reviewed and noted they had never seen this combination, and recommended changing, but upon further review, they decided it would be acceptable  to keep the three categories</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>189</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-09-24 13:17:23]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-09-24 13:17:23]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-gender-race]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="gender-race"><![CDATA[gender-race]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette Use by Education</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/cigarette-use-by-education/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Sep 2020 02:05:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=252</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","textColor":"green","fontSize":"huge","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-text-align-center has-huge-font-size has-green-color compacted"><strong>Prevalence was highest for people who stopped their education. </strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Smoking prevalence* was highest for individuals who stopped their education at the primary and incomplete secondary school levels (approx. <strong><span class="has-inline-color has-blue-color"><em>27%</em></span></strong>). The groups with the lowest smoking rates in these data were students still in school <strong>(7.5%)</strong> and those with no education <strong>(11.4%).</strong> <br>A large proportion of individuals with no education are older and live in rural areas, which may explain the lower rates in this group. Current research in South Africa has found that young people who leave school early generally tend to smoke more than those who stay in school, highlighting the relationship between education and the risk of smoking.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left has-small-font-size">*For individuals 18 years and older; prevalence estimates overlap for several groups, however these estimates may still be interpreted as an accurate representation of prevalence for each group.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":425,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/education_main.svg" alt="" class="wp-image-425"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-small-font-size">Source:&nbsp;<a href="https://bmcpublichealth.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12889-019-6454-5" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Rachana Desai, R., et al., 2019</a>. Cigarette smoking and reasons for leaving school among school dropouts in South Africa.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>252</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-09-25 02:05:18]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-09-25 02:05:18]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-education]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="education"><![CDATA[education]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-race]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Gender and Age</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/cigarette-use-by-gender-and-a/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Sep 2020 12:55:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=295</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"huge","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-huge-font-size has-green-color compacted"><strong>Men aged 25 - 54 (39.8%) had the highest smoking prevalence rate in 2017.</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">The prevalence rates of men aged 18 - 24 (26.0%) and men aged 55 and older (30.4%) did not differ statistically. Smoking rates for women did not differ statistically for any age group. Though these numbers do not differ statistically, they may still be interpreted as an accurate representation of prevalence for those groups.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>295</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-09-25 12:55:04]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[cigarette-use-by-gender-and-a]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[prevalence]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="prevalence_category" nicename="gender-age"><![CDATA[gender-age]]></category>

		</wp:postmeta>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Gender and Education</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/cigarette-use-by-gender-and-age/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Sep 2020 12:57:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=298</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong>Smoking prevalence was highest for males who stopped their education at the primary and incomplete secondary school levels. </strong>&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Smoking prevalence was highest for males who stopped their education at the primary and incomplete secondary school levels (approximately 46%) and lowest among those with no schooling (24.7%) and still in school (14.8%). The smoking rates of those with matric and post secondary education do not differ statistically from one another, though these numbers may still be interpreted as an accurate representation of prevalence for those groups.&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Smoking prevalence is much lower for females than males. Those without education (4.8%) and those still in school (1.3%) have the lowest smoking rates.&nbsp; The other groups (females with primary school, incomplete secondary school, matric and post secondary education) are not statistically different from each other, however, these estimates may still be interpreted as an accurate representation of prevalence for each group.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->[:]]]></content:encoded>

		<pubDate>Tue, 20 Oct 2020 19:05:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<title>Stories</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/illicit-stories/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Oct 2020 11:52:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=657</guid>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Illicit Trade</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 Sep 2020 18:17:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=343</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:heading {"level":1,"className":"compacted","textColor":"blue","fontSize":"huge"} -->
<h1 class="compacted has-blue-color has-text-color has-huge-font-size">Illicit Trade of Cigarettes in South Africa</h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1182,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/money_icon.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1182"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center"><!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="compacted has-light-blue-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Many countries have successfully increased tobacco taxes without illicit trade increasing.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":10} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:10%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1183,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/police_icon.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1183"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-light-blue-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Strong enforcement and an independent track and track system are the most effective way of combating illicit trade.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"left","textColor":"dark-gray","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-left has-dark-gray-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size">This fact sheet defines the various<strong> types of illicit</strong> tobacco trade in South Africa, discusses the overall level of illicit trade, and presents estimates of the prevalence of illicit trade within South Africa. Finally,<strong> myths promulgated by the tobacco industry</strong> are examined and addressed, and suggestions for methods to reduce illicit trade presented. <strong>Success stories</strong> from other countries are also highlighted.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>790</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-09-30 18:17:25]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-09-30 18:17:25]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[illicit]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Illicit Trade Prevalence</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/illicit-prevalence/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov 2020 14:16:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?page_id=1242</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"compacted","textColor":"green","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="compacted has-green-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Between 2002 - 2010, illicit trade in tobacco products was estimated at 10% in South Africa,</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size"> and several companies involved in illegal production and sales of illegal cigarettes were shut down. However in the 2010s illicit tobacco consumption rose, largely due to weakening  enforcement capacities at the South African Revenue Service with regards to tobacco.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1242</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-30 14:16:35]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-30 14:16:35]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[illicit-prevalence]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>790</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Combating</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/illicit/illicit-combating/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov 2020 18:41:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?page_id=1283</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:group -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><div class="wp-block-group__inner-container"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-normal-font-size"><br>The illicit tobacco market is a global problem and requires a global solution. There are global strategies in place, such as the World Health Organization’s (WHO) Framework Convention on Tobacco Control and WHO Protocol to Eliminate Illicit Trade in Tobacco Products, which are essential in the fight against illicit tobacco.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Most of the illicit cigarettes smoked in South Africa are produced locally in legal facilities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1283</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-11-30 18:41:24]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-11-30 18:41:24]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[illicit-combating]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>790</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

					<item>
		<title>Health Burden</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Dec 2020 14:06:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=1333</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:heading {"level":1,"className":"compacted","textColor":"blue","fontSize":"huge"} -->
<h1 class="compacted has-blue-color has-text-color has-huge-font-size">Health Burden of Tobacco Use in South Africa</h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":11.1} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:11.1%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1611,"sizeSlug":"large","className":"is-style-rounded"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image is-style-rounded"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/circle_with_pack-1.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1611"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":65.3} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:65.3%"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-light-blue-color has-text-color has-large-font-size">Tobacco use is the leading cause of preventable death</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Globally, smoking caused the death of 6.3 million people in 2016. In South Africa in 2016, there were 25,708 smoking-attributable deaths for people aged 35 - 75. This translates to 520,598 potential life years lost.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->[:fr]<!-- wp:heading {"level":1,"className":"compacted","textColor":"blue","fontSize":"huge"} -->
<h1 class="compacted has-blue-color has-text-color has-huge-font-size">Health Burden of Tobacco Use in South Africa</h1>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":11.1} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:11.1%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1575,"sizeSlug":"large","className":"is-style-rounded"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image is-style-rounded"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/circle_with_pack.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1575"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"top","width":65.3} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-top" style="flex-basis:65.3%"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"light-blue","fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-light-blue-color has-text-color has-large-font-size"><strong>Tobacco</strong> use is the leading cause of preventable death</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Globally, smoking caused the death of 6.3 million people in 2016. In South Africa in 2016, there were 25,708 smoking-attributable deaths for people aged 35 - 75. This translates to 520,598 potential life years lost.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->[:]]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Cost</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/health-cost/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 Dec 2020 13:55:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

					<item>
		<title>Secondhand</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/health-secondhand/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Dec 2020 03:24:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=1395</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1434,"width":1114,"height":412,"sizeSlug":"full"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-full is-resized"><img src="http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/image-11.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1434" width="1114" height="412"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Secondhand smoke exposure is responsible for the death of more than 880,000 individuals worldwide every year.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Secondhand smoke contains more than 7,000 chemicals, 70 of which can cause cancer, and hundreds more that are toxic. About half of the secondhand smoke comes from the smouldering butt of a cigarette while the rest comes from exhaled smoke.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Research on the effect of secondhand smoke is ongoing, and the conditions that have already been proved to be causally linked to secondhand smoke are shown here.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:fr]<!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1577,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/second_hand_landscape-1024x379.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1577"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Secondhand smoke exposure is responsible for the death of more than 880,000 individuals worldwide every year.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"normal"} -->
<p class="has-normal-font-size">Secondhand smoke contains more than 7,000 chemicals, 70 of which can cause cancer, and hundreds more that are toxic. About half of the secondhand smoke comes from the smouldering butt of a cigarette while the rest comes from exhaled smoke.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Research on the effect of secondhand smoke is ongoing, and the conditions that have already been proved to be causally linked to secondhand smoke are shown here.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1395</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-12-03 03:24:00]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-12-03 03:24:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[health-secondhand]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1344</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[inline_featured_image]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Agriculture</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/health-agriculture/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Dec 2020 15:24:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=1530</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate-plus"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-plus-font-size"><br>Symptoms of diseases caused by tobacco farming</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate-plus"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-plus-font-size">Tobacco is a labour intensive crop. Hand harvesting remains the preferred method, as tobacco leaves mature at different rates, machinery is expensive and leaves picked mechanically are of lower quality. <br>Farm workers can face risks from pesticides and other chemicals if safety protocols are not adhered to. Farm workers can also suffer from heat exhaustion during harvesting.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size">Green tobacco sickness</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Green tobacco sickness, which is a risk unique to tobacco farming, occurs when nicotine is absorbed through the skin as farm<br>workers are harvesting tobacco. Farm workers can protect themselves by wearing protective clothing, but can still be at risk if their clothing becomes saturated from rain, dew or perspiration. Some symptoms of green tobacco sickness are similar to heat<br>exhaustion and pesticide poisoning. If healthcare workers are not familiar with this illness, it may be misdiagnosed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"left","id":1539,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignleft size-large"><img src="http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/image-14.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1539"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><a href="/en/agriculture">see the Agriculture Factsheet for more information</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:fr]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate-plus"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-plus-font-size"><br>Symptoms of diseases caused by tobacco farming</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate-plus"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-plus-font-size">Tobacco is a labour intensive crop. Hand harvesting remains the preferred method, as tobacco leaves mature at different rates, machinery is expensive and leaves picked mechanically are of lower quality. <br>Farm workers can face risks from pesticides and other chemicals if safety protocols are not adhered to. Farm workers can also suffer from heat exhaustion during harvesting.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size">Green tobacco sickness</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Green tobacco sickness, which is a risk unique to tobacco farming, occurs when nicotine is absorbed through the skin as farm<br>workers are harvesting tobacco. Farm workers can protect themselves by wearing protective clothing, but can still be at risk if their clothing becomes saturated from rain, dew or perspiration. Some symptoms of green tobacco sickness are similar to heat<br>exhaustion and pesticide poisoning. If healthcare workers are not familiar with this illness, it may be misdiagnosed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"align":"left","id":1580,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="alignleft size-large"><img src="https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/link_icon.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1580"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><a href="/en/agriculture">see the Agriculture Factsheet for more information</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1530</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-12-10 15:24:56]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-12-10 15:24:56]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[health-agriculture]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1344</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[inline_featured_image]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Use</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/health/health-use/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Dec 2020 12:54:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/?page_id=1546</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Smoking can harm nearly all systems in the human body, and causes many diseases, including lung cancer, which is the leading cause of cancer deaths in South Africa. Global studies show that cigarette smoking is linked to 80-90% of lung cancer deaths.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":7} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:7%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1365,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/image.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1365"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>Men</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Smoking rates among men are 5 times higher than smoking rates among women in South Africa.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"width":7} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:7%"><!-- wp:image {"align":"center","id":1367,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<div class="wp-block-image"><figure class="aligncenter size-large"><img src="http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/image-1.png" alt="" class="wp-image-1367"/></figure></div>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>Women</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Smoking for women has additional risk when smoking while pregnant. Smoking can cause low birth weight, birth defects and complications with the placenta which can be dangerous for both the mother and the fetus.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->[:fr]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"regular"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-regular-font-size">Smoking can harm nearly all systems in the human body, and causes many diseases, including lung cancer, which is the leading cause of cancer deaths in South Africa. Global studies show that cigarette smoking is linked to 80-90% of lung cancer deaths.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:columns -->
<div class="wp-block-columns"><!-- wp:column {"width":7} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:7%"></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>Men</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Smoking rates among men are 5 times higher than smoking rates among women in South Africa.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"width":7} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:7%"></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column -->
<div class="wp-block-column"><!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-green-color has-text-color has-intermediate-font-size"><strong>Women</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"intermediate"} -->
<p class="has-intermediate-font-size">Smoking for women has additional risk when smoking while pregnant. Smoking can cause low birth weight, birth defects and complications with the placenta which can be dangerous for both the mother and the fetus.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1546</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-12-11 12:54:22]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-12-11 12:54:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[health-use]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>1344</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[inline_featured_image]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[0]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Cigarette use by Gender and Location</title>
		<link>https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/prevalence/cigarette-use-by-gender-and-location/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Sep 2020 13:04:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://wp.tobacco.dgstg.org/?post_type=prevalence&#038;p=305</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[:en]<!-- wp:paragraph {"textColor":"green","fontSize":"huge","className":"compacted"} -->
<p class="has-text-color has-huge-font-size has-green-color compacted"><strong>Females living in rural areas had the lowest smoking prevalence rates in 2017 at just under 2%</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Women in urban areas had a higher smoking rate at 10.1%. Males in rural areas (30.5%) smoked less than the males in urban areas (38.2%), who have the highest smoking rate.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:more -->
<!--more-->
<!-- /wp:more -->

<!-- wp:nextpage -->
<!--nextpage-->
<!-- /wp:nextpage -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-small-font-size">Source: <a href="https://bmcpediatr.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2431-11-58">Mashita, R. J., et al</a>. (2011). Current smoking behaviour among rural South African children: Ellisras Longitudinal Study.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->[:]]]></content:encoded>
